newsitem.title: USA: Palmer price tag covers stock, debt.
newsitem.headline: Palmer price tag covers stock, debt.

text.p: Price Communications Corp's proposed $880 million acquisition of Palmer Wireless Inc involves payment of $489 million for Palmer stock and options, with rest of the price tag comprising payment of Palmer debt, Palmer said Friday.
Palmer shares were up 4-3/16 to 16-1/4 following news that Price had agreed to acquire the company for $17.50 cash per share.
Palmer, headquartered in Ft. Myers, Fla. owns and operates 18 non-wireline cellular telephone systems in Florida, Alabama, Georgia and South Carolina.
Earlier this year Palmer shares rose above $15 on rumors that the company was on the auction block. The stock fell as investors became concerned that the company would not find a buyer.
Price officials were not available for comment on the merger pact.
